snippet: Friends and colleagues remember Dummett, one of the 20th century's most influential philosophers, who died last week.
abstract: Friends and colleagues remember Dummett, one of the 20th century's most influential philosophers, who died last week.
lead_paragraph: Sir Michael Dummett, one of the most influential philosophers of the 20th century, died last week in Oxford, England. He held the position of Wykeham Professor of Logic at Oxford University from 1979 until his retirement in 1992. Below is a gathering of reminiscences from fellow philosophers, including Hilary Putnam, Timothy Williamson, Dorothy Edgington, Daniel Isaacson, and several others who knew Dummett, worked with him or were influenced by his life and work. We invite readers to offer their own contributions in the comments section.
